00020 
00021 enum WWWencodingType { 
00022     TAG  = 0, // HTML tags (no conversion)
00023     HTML = 1, // replace ('<','>','"','&') with (&lt; &gt; &amp; &qout;)
00024     URL  = 2  // replace spaces with '+', and other special characters with %XX
00025 };
00026 //
00027 // Automatic state shifts after each append operation:
00028 //   TAG->HTML
00029 //   HTML->TAG
00030 //   URL->TAG
00031 //
00032 
00033 class FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY WWWconnection {  
00034     friend class WWWapi;
00035     friend class CGIapi;
00036     friend class QueueManager;
00037     friend class HTTPapi;
00038     
00039   public:
00040     
00041     typedef void (*UserDataDestructor)(void* userData);
00042     typedef bool (*handler)(WWWconnection& con);
00043 
00044     void*              userData;
00045     UserDataDestructor userDataDestructor;
00046 
00047     void setUserData(void* data, UserDataDestructor destructor = NULL) { 
00048         userData = data;
00049         userDataDestructor = destructor;
00050     }
00051 
00052     //
00053     // Append string to reply buffer
00054     //
00055     WWWconnection& append(char const* str);
00056     WWWconnection& append(wchar_t const* str);
00057     //
00058     // Append binary data
00059     // 
00060     WWWconnection& append(const void *buf, int len);
00061     
00062     WWWconnection& operator << (char const* str) { 
00063         return append(str);
00064     }
00065      WWWconnection& operator << (wchar_t const* str) { 
00066         return append(str);
00067     }
00068    
00069     void setEncoding(WWWencodingType type) { encoding = type; }
00070 
00071     WWWconnection& operator << (WWWencodingType type) { 
00072         setEncoding(type);
00073         return *this;
00074     }
00075     WWWconnection& operator << (int value) { 
00076         char buf[32];
00077         sprintf(buf, "%d", value);
00078         return append(buf);
00079     }
00080     WWWconnection& operator << (double value) {
00081         char buf[32];
00082         sprintf(buf, "%f", value);
00083         return append(buf);
00084     }
00085   
00086     WWWconnection& operator << (db_int8 value) {
00087         char buf[32];
00088         sprintf(buf, INT8_FORMAT, value);
00089         return append(buf);
00090     }
00091     
00092     WWWconnection& operator << (oid_t value) {        
00093         char buf[32];   
00094         sprintf(buf, "%ld", (long)value);
00095         return append(buf);
00096     }
00097 
00098     char* getStub() { return stub; }
00099 
00100     char* getAddress() { return address; }
00101 
00102     char* getPeer() { return peer; }
00103 
00104     //
00105     // Compare content of the string with the end of the reply buffer
00106     //
00107     bool terminatedBy(char const* str) const;
00108 
00109     //
00110     // Get value of variable from request string. If name is not present in 
00111     // string NULL is returned. Parameter 'n' can be used to get n-th
00112     // value of variable for multiple selection slot. Zero value of n 
00113     // corresponds to the first variable's value, 1 - to the second,...
00114     // When no more values are available NULL is returned.
00115     //
00116     char* get(char const* name, int n = 0);
00117     
00118     //
00119     // Associatte value with name
00120     //
00121     void addPair(char const* name, char const* value);
00122     
00123     WWWconnection();
00124     ~WWWconnection();
00125 
00126   protected: 
00127     enum { hash_table_size = 1013 };
00128     socket_t*   sock;
00129     char*       reply_buf;
00130     size_t      reply_buf_size;
00131     size_t      reply_buf_used;
00132     char*       stub;
00133     char*       address;
00134     char*       peer;
00135     WWWconnection*  next;
00136     WWWencodingType encoding;
00137    
00138 
00139     struct name_value_pair { 
00140         name_value_pair* next;
00141         char const*      name;
00142         char const*      value;
00143         unsigned         hash_code;
00144     };
00145 
00146     name_value_pair* hash_table[hash_table_size];
00147     name_value_pair* free_pairs;
00148 
00149     char* extendBuffer(size_t inc);
00150 
00151 
00152     //
00153     // Deallocate all resources hold by connection. It is not possible to 
00154     // call get_value() or reply() method after this. Method reset()
00155     // is implicitly called by WWWapi::get() method.
00156     //
00157     void reset();
00158 
00159     //
00160     // Unpack requests paramters
00161     //
00162     char* unpack(char* body, size_t body_length);
00163 };
00164

00166 class FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY WWWapi { 
00167   public:
00168     struct dispatcher { 
00169         char const*         page;
00170         WWWconnection::handler func;
00171         // filled by contracutor of WWWapi
00172         unsigned            hash_code;
00173         dispatcher*         collision_chain;
00174     };
00175 
00176   protected:
00177     socket_t*   sock;
00178     bool        canceled;
00179     char*       address;
00180     dbDatabase& db;
00181     enum { hash_table_size = 113  };
00182     dispatcher* hash_table[hash_table_size];
00183 
00184     bool dispatch(WWWconnection& con, char* page);
00185 
00186   public:
00187     WWWapi(dbDatabase& db, int n_handlers, dispatcher* dispatch_table);
00188     virtual~WWWapi();
00189 
00190     //
00191     // Bind and listen socket
00192     //
00193     bool open(char const* socket_address = "localhost:80", 
00194               socket_t::socket_domain domain = socket_t::sock_global_domain, 
00195               int listen_queue = DEFAULT_LISTEN_QUEUE_SIZE);
00196 
00197 
00198     //
00199     // Read and execute requests
00200     //
00201     virtual bool serve(WWWconnection& con) = 0;
00202 
00203     //
00204     // Accept new connection by the socket
00205     //
00206     bool connect(WWWconnection& con);
00207 
00208     //
00209     // Cancel acception of connections
00210     // 
00211     void cancel();
00212 
00213     //
00214     // Close socket
00215     // 
00216     void close();
00217 };

00220 //
00221 // Interaction with WWW server by means of CGI protocol and CGIatub program
00222 //
00223 class FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY CGIapi : public WWWapi { 
00224   public:
00225     virtual bool serve(WWWconnection& con);
00226 
00227     CGIapi(dbDatabase& db, int n_handlers, dispatcher* dispatch_table) 
00228     : WWWapi(db, n_handlers, dispatch_table) {}
00229 };

00231     
00232 // 
00233 // Built-in implementation of sunset of subset of HTTP protocol
00234 //
00235 class FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY HTTPapi : public WWWapi { 
00236   protected:
00237     time_t connectionHoldTimeout;
00238     bool   keepConnectionAlive;
00239 
00240     bool handleRequest(WWWconnection& con, char* begin, char* end, 
00241                        char* host, bool& result);
00242 
00243   public:
00244     virtual bool serve(WWWconnection& con);
00245 
00246     HTTPapi(dbDatabase& db, int n_handlers, dispatcher* dispatch_table, 
00247             bool persistentConnections = false,
00248             time_t connectionHoldTimeoutSec = WAIT_FOREVER) 
00249     : WWWapi(db, n_handlers, dispatch_table) 
00250     {
00251         keepConnectionAlive = persistentConnections;
00252         connectionHoldTimeout = connectionHoldTimeoutSec;
00253     }
00254 };

00256 class FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY QueueManager { 
00257     WWWconnection*   connectionPool;
00258     WWWconnection*   freeList;
00259     WWWconnection*   waitList;
00260     dbMutex          mutex;
00261     dbLocalSemaphore go;
00262     dbLocalEvent     done;
00263     dbThread*        threads;
00264     int              nThreads;
00265     WWWapi*          server;
00266     dbDatabase&      db;
00267 
00268     static void thread_proc handleThread(void* arg);
00269     void handle();
00270     
00271   public:
00272     void stop();
00273     void start();
00274 
00275     QueueManager(WWWapi& api, // WWWapi should be opened
00276                  dbDatabase& db,
00277                  int     nThreads = 8, 
00278                  int     connectionQueueLen = 64);
00279     ~QueueManager();
00280 };
